title: Raising The Odds For A Special Connection
text:
Let's deal with reality here. What one views as a liability, another may view as an asset. The primary reasons we are alone aren't due to things out of our control, but the choices we make. Do we view ourselves as others see us or as we feel we should be? Do we expect others to be attracted to something they don't find attractive or expect them to conform to our mold? Do we attempt to mold ourselves into what others seek? In other words, do we start out choosing a person who is compatible, or do we expect the relationship to become compatible? Do we choose a partner based on what we believe we can get from the relationship or what we believe we can bring to the relationship? I've decided to list some things women believe make them less desirable as a partner and then list those things others have stated as having made me less desirable as a partner. Realize that these things are rarely universally positive or negative to all. If we choose a partner who appreciates our qualities, we'll be seen as positive; if we choose a partner who is uncomfortable with our qualities, we'll be seen as negative. It's not about changing ourselves or others, but choosing compatible partners.

Some of the qualities women believe make them less desirable to men (which I don't view as limiting factors):
Age; height; past experiences; physical challenges; non-contagious medical conditions (even terminal ones); introversion; feeling safer and more fulfilled with plants, animals or machines than people; small breasts; hair issues (long, short, curly, straight, etc.); quiet; homebody; shy; super intelligent or limited formal education; assertion and open communication; plain looks or what is labeled as unattractive; inexperienced; inner strength; mathematically inclined 
Some of the qualities women believe make them less desirable to men (which I also view as limiting factors):
Perfectionist; extremist; feeling entitled to be provided or push their agenda onto others; self-centeredness (insensitive, disrespectful, inconsiderate, tactless, etc.); overweight; aggressive; over-reactive; defensive; deceptively withholding what's known to be important; lashing out rather than seeking clarification; speaking or acting before thinking; irresponsible; materialistic; living beyond their means; vague/evasive communication or talking at others; superiority; loud; argumentative; negative/pessimistic; no interest in physical intimacy; power-hungry; fame and fortune hunter; chemical escape patterns; controlling; manipulative; demanding; critical; jealous; dependent; sarcastic
You'll notice most of the qualities I'm not attracted to are those within a person's control, while I am rarely turned off by things out of a person's control (i.e. genetics).
Some of the qualities making me less desirable to women:
Middle-aged; modest income; living a simple farm life in the country; multiple college degrees; prioritizing open/honest communication, health & fitness and nature & agriculture; drive a truck rather than a car; knee issue that prevents jarring activities like running, jumping or dancing; held off completing finish work on my home (wanting to design and build it with a partner) so limited storage increases the clutter; functional introvert who prefers one-on-one or small groups to social settings; prefers subtleties to extremes; prefers maintaining and fixing things rather than replacing with the latest ultimate possession; focuses on the journey rather than the end goal; affectionate; allergic to cats; agnostic (raised Jewish)

I don't expect anyone to change for me, and I don't plan on changing in any of the areas that are important to me (I am very flexible in all other areas), but it would be nice to connect with someone who can appreciate me as I am, as I'll appreciate her as she is. Ideally, I'd love something long-term, but I am also open to short-term. Maybe you are too busy to maintain your vision of an ideal relationship or are here temporarily. I believe in making the most of what is available rather than focusing on what could or should be. You don't need to announce me to the world, but I'm not interested in being hidden, either. If you are open to a limited relationship, just let me know the guidelines and I will respect them. I am open to a friendship or whatever depth we decide works for us. I have chosen to no longer settle just to be in a relationship. Whatever type of relationship you and I choose to develop, we will both see value in and appreciate the other as that person already is, or we will continue our search elsewhere. We seek no more than can be expected of us. Let us create what works best for us... together. Emails without substance will be ignored.

title: Are you *truly* capable of thinking outside the box?
text:
Fact is, few people are *really* capable of thinking outside the box. Finding some girl or woman who does has been one of my goals in life. I say girl first, because the highest probability for finding her is in a late teenager, possibly a college fresh(wo)man, before all the official programming has succeeded in dulling the mind.

Schopenhauer quite famously said: "All truth passes through three stages. First, it is ridiculed. Second, it is violently opposed. Third, it is accepted as being self-evident." If you are the type interested in what they don't teach you in school, both about the world, and yourself, I am the man you want to connect to and become friends with... At any rate, here are a few quotes to get you going: "The spirit of inquiry, the search for greater truth beyond religion and science, the profound seriousness of doing real thinking, philosophy and ontology -- these are almost totally lacking in humanity. text:

If we're alone, there is probably a reason for that. Mine is I choose to live a simple life on a farm, which isn't seen as attractive by most women. You may be too busy for a relationship, are here for a limited time, have what others may consider physical flaws or even a non-contagious terminal disease. I don't need forever. I'd rather have short-term quality than long-term toleration, though long-term quality isn't something I'd be averse to. My list of qualifications for this special friend is very short [respectful, tranquil, easygoing, communicative yet not talkative, slender (BMI of 20 or less), no contagious diseases and prefer subtleties to extremes]. I don't need you to announce me to the world, but I don't want to be your hidden secret, either. I've shared my preferences as much for you as for me, for I know these qualities tend to energize me and motivate me to be the best partner I can be. You deserve someone who desires and appreciates you, not someone who focuses on satisfying his own needs and/or tolerates you. Some other qualities may be nice, but most won't add significantly to my motivation or investment in what we choose to develop together. Chronological age is irrelevant to me, as long as you aren't immature or just want to talk about illness, death or grandkids.

I understand you have preferences, also, and I respect that. I'll list a little about myself, in case these may be issues for you. I am a divorced, well-educated professional, 6', 155#, with brown hair (lightly sprinkled with grey) and hazel eyes (with glasses). Having no cartilage in one knee limits jarring activities (i.e. jogging or dancing), yet I still get around unassisted, maintain my farm and love hiking in the forest. I am a functional introvert. I'm fine one-on-one or in small groups, but am only comfortable in larger groups when I have a specific purpose for being there (i.e. teaching a class). I have no interest in sports or religion (though I do enjoy philosophical discussions). I maintain a healthy balance of responsibility and playfulness, along with being realistically optimistic. I focus on opportunities, not obstacles. I am respectful and accepting of differences in others, feeling no need to push my agenda onto others or expecting them to conform to my beliefs. I prioritize health and fitness without taking anything to extreme. I'm not a foodie. I love veggies, though prefer tasting the food rather than the spices people tend to drown the food in. I am very attentive and sensual, preferring long drawn-out encounters to rushed performances (it's about the journey, not the destination). I love learning, along with sharing acquired knowledge with those who seek it from me. My career has focused on helping others rather than acquiring wealth. I am very allergic to cats.

To make this convenient for both of us, it is probably best if you live in the vicinity of the San Fernando, Santa Clarita or Antelope Valleys. If what I've written is of interest to you, or it describes someone you know, please reach out. Disrespectful or one-line responses and spam will just be sent to my spam filter.

title: Do Guys Still Date?
text:
Single life just isn't for me, but really have learned over the last few years what I'm looking for, and really not looking to get into a relationship just for the sake of being in a relationship. 

I'm a normal guy here, I get along with my mom, have a great job, a condo, a car, and admittedly, I hate clutter. I'm the kind of guy who would buy flowers for no reason, kissing you because you are there, or cuddling up under the covers while watching a good movie.

I truly believe in monogamy in all its aspects, i.e. shouldn't have a profile on a dating site if you're committed to and in love with someone.

Lookwise, I think I'm a pretty nice looking man...but beauty is in the eye of the beholder right? I do not have a gym body nor do I suspect I ever will...lol..but I am height/weight proportionate. I'm white, 5ft 11in, 182lbs, negative and definitely not a shallow guy but there has to be some sort of chemistry and attraction. I've learned a lot along the way... under 50 and over 30 works best for me, latin, or ethnic, and a bottom.

Believe me, I'm not perfect and I'm not expecting perfection. Everyone has some sort of baggage, and thinking otherwise is really not being honest or realistic with yourself. 

I primarily live in Palm Springs, but my work takes me throughout Southern California. Multiple residences will probably be in my future.

I like nice dinners, whether it's a romantic sit down dinner or have BBQ, I'm all over the place..lol. I also like movies, occasional baseball game, long drives, slow walks, soft kisses with gentle but all knowing embraces.

There's nothing like holding hands with your special someone while driving, occasionally glancing over only to see him glancing over at you, all the while knowing you both are thinking the same thing..."I love this man." 

Really, at any event, I could care less how good the spectacle is, as long as I'm with you.

Please no games, unless we're talking Monopoly..hehe
Interested? Send me a message along with a picture or two. 
And if you are wondering...yes, the pic is me.

title: As the work day ends
text:
Yesterday I taught my college classes in the a.m., then tutored at a local high school in the late afternoon. Got off work around 6 pm just as it was beginning to get dark outside. And I thought how nice it would be to be able to call my boyfriend (if I had one) and meet for an after-work drink at one of the WeHo bars, and sip a beer or glass of wine and watch the traffic go by on the boulevard as the day winds down, and enjoy being two upscale gay guys enjoying life in sunny LA ... before we'd go home and fuck, of course! 

I'm hoping to find a nice guy/potential b/f with the following attributes:

- Good looking and in-shape
- Intelligent and interested in the world
- Decent job and self-supporting
- Creative (or appreciative of such)
- Live in or close to WeHo (I don't do long distance)
- Capable of responding to my posting with an intelligent paragraph instead of stats and "Sup?"

Do I ask too much. Apparently so, since in 2015 at least 90% of guys who wrote to me did so with the stats/Sup thing. (The level of stupidity and/or illiteracy in our society today is breathtaking!)

Anyway, as for me...

I'm a brand new college professor; enjoy occasional museum outings, a classical music concert, a weekend out of town, and planning for our future together. I'm a writer, teacher and media person. Creative and artistic. Politically and socially interested but not "ego-invested". (I've been watching the election stuff on TV of late, but will soon tire of that will refuse to turn on a news channel for the rest of the election season.) I like things like walking the aisles in the grocery store together, a quiet lunch out, etc. Little things, normal things.

I'm 5'7", 138 lbs., sexually versatile, (HIV-negative and DDF, you be the same), love making-out, work-out regularly, live in WeHo, don't have a car (by choice) and don't do long distance relationships, so please be fairly local. I have a good income, live in a comfortable apartment, and am not into all the teen-centric preoccupations like cell phones and ipods and talking mindlessly about music, celebrities and pop culture as if those things are actually important. A glass of wine, a good book and quiet conversation suit me fine. And I date ALL RACES.

PLEASE enclose a PHOTO if you contact me. It helps a lot. A lot!!!

title: ARE YOU 60+ & WANTING TO CUDDLE?
text:
Let me try this again. When I ran a similar ad recently I got answers from women in their 40s and 50s who thought I was looking for a mistress. I am not.

I am an old man, in good shape, hwp. I have been widowed for many years after a long marriage. I am not seeking love much less a wife or live-in companion (or mistress). What I am seeking is a sensual, friendly relationship with an age-appropriate woman. I crave physical contact - hugs, strokes, cuddling. This is not the same as looking to get laid. Whether it goes in that direction would only be by mutual choice and after some time.

The essence of the relationship I seek is a mutual desire for warm, comforting physical contact. Whether we find other interests in common, like music, movies, art, books, hiking, would remain to be seen. We might be very compatible physically and have nothing else in common. Or maybe we would. In any event, I am not offering or at this point in my life emotionally capable of being in a marriage-like arrangement so if that is your long-term goal I am not your man.

You should be at least 60 years old. Please do not answer this ad if you are younger! There is no upper age limit as long as you are in touch with your physical desire for human contact. I have no restrictions as to your race or ethnicity. (I am white.) Within limits, I have no preferences as to your physical type. (I would draw the line at what is called SSBBW in CraigsList-ese.) The women who have been important in my life have ranged from skinny to Rubenesque; their shape has not been one of the most important things about any of them.

I live alone in downtown LA. I can host or travel. We could arrange a first meeting someplace public for coffee or a drink. I would like this to happen soon. Since I am retired I am free much of the time.

If you reply please put CONTACT as the subject to weed out CL spam and scams. If you reply I will respond with my name, photos, and phone / text #.

title: Vegan/vegetarian searching for love and adventure with fellow romantic
text:
I haven't gone out on a real date for a long time and just can't see myself getting involved with someone who eats flesh (including eggs, fish, crustaceans, octopus, etc), so with holidays coming up and if you're like me and avoid family dinners and reunions and all that craziness, maybe we're both ready to try something a little different this time around.

I'm not into hookups -- when it comes to all things sexual, I need to be making love, not lust. May sound strange these days, but if I'm not madly love with a woman, I can't even function.

I'm independently wealthy and own several companies operating globally that I directly manage, which in some ways is a curse because it makes it difficult to find someone who isn't interested in me simply because of what I have or what I can do for them. I'm a pragmatic realist, so I don't expect someone to not take into account my wealth when choosing whether or not to become involved with me, and I've come to accept this as inevitable, but I do wish to be with someone who would want to stay with me even if I didn't have all this materialist excess.

I'm interested in all manner of arts, from music [particularly synthpop/80s/darkwave/electroclash], theatre [stage dramas], esotericism, Germanic romanticism, and aesthetic nihilism. If you're at all familiar with names like Adam Parfrey, Kenneth Anger, Boyd Rice, Douglas P, Michael Moynihan, Anton LaVey, Genesis P Orridge, et al ... more than likely we'll get along to a greater or lesser extent.

The one adventure I've still yet to conclude is the one where I can share my life with a woman I can get hopelessly addicted to. And yes, I do know that in I'm posting this in the transgender section. When you've been through hell and somehow survived, these sorts of distinctions become meaningless. If a woman, whatever her biological status might be, tells me she is a woman and everything about her personality and emotional reality all confirm this, then that's good enough for me.

title: Want more than a 1-nighter?
text: We're a couple of witty, vibrant, interesting Angelenos looking to share the good thing we've got. We're conveniently located in Downtown Los Angeles, center of a burgeoning cultural/dining/nightlife scene. We can (and prefer to) host. We are most definitely polyamorous. So if you like the idea of both, or just one, that's fine by us. We're hoping to find a solo bifem for the two of us, but the ideas/attitudes would apply to the other scenarios. We both date individually, and are interested in expanding our poly/sexually open friends. (And we do mean friends.... we aren't sexually indiscriminate, and don't try to bed every person we encounter.) We're looking for a galpal to share our local adventures with -- we've been exploring downtown for a few years, and have developed a list of favorites, but there is an even longer list of places/things we've not yet done! There would be clothed and vertical activities as well as those best accomplished naked and horizontal. We have three rescues, so it's probably best if you're not allergic to dogs. We're good at being eclectic; as comfortable staying in and reading the Sunday Times as we are hitting a local cultural event or untried eatery. We don't need constant sensory stimulation to be content, but also welcome breaks in the routine. Looking for someone who can "go with the flow" as well as embrace spontaneity with good humor and a willingness of spirit. We are generally "out and about" several days/nights a week exploring what's available in our vast downtown area -- since it's slowly developing into a destination spot, there seems to be a never-ending supply of things to do! Art tours, dining (adventurous and/or new), museums, lectures.... It's a hackneyed and over-used phrase, "easygoing", but there are those of us who deserve the descriptive: we're not easily ruffled, offended or flustered; take change well; are fairly flexible in our expectations; generally have a calm demeanor, and are understanding of the shifts/surprises life throws at our collective ability to schedule things. If we might interest you, you should be: -Looking for interaction with a couple (discreet, of course -- we don't wear our sexual activity on our sleeves). -ok with BBWs. -Truly bi (if you want to date us both). -Reasonably available. -Wanting something rather consistent (permanent or at least the expectation of long-term) -Desiring some level of relationship with the people you bed. -The opposite of high-maintenance (we just can't do that), not flaky (annoying!), and sure of what you want (no experience necessary, just gotta be ready to make that leap). I hope we hear from you. Nikki
